question: What is the primary advantage of using an ArrayList over a regular array in Java?
options: A) ArrayList can store primitive data types.
B) ArrayList automatically expands and shrinks as items are added or removed.
C) ArrayList does not require importing any packages.
D) ArrayList is faster than a regular array.
answer: B) ArrayList automatically expands and shrinks as items are added or removed.

question: Which package must be imported to use the ArrayList class in Java?
Which method is used to check if an ArrayList is empty?
Which method is used to add an element to an ArrayList?
What does the size() method of the ArrayList class return?
options: A) The capacity of the ArrayList.
B) The number of elements in the ArrayList.
C) The index of the last element.
D) The memory size of the ArrayList.
answer: B) The number of elements in the ArrayList.

What is the purpose of the toString() method in the ArrayList class?
options: A) It converts the ArrayList to a primitive array.
B) It returns a string representation of the ArrayList.
C) It sorts the elements of the ArrayList.
D) It clears all elements from the ArrayList.
answer: B) It returns a string representation of the ArrayList.

question: What is the output of the following code?
Which of the following is true about the ArrayList class in Java?
options: A) It can only store primitive data types.
B) It can store objects of any type.
C) It requires a fixed size at the time of creation.
D) It cannot store duplicate elements.
answer: B) It can store objects of any type.
